## Setup Instructions

### 1. Create Directory Structure

```bash
mkdir -p docs/_static docs/_templates docs/api docs/handlers docs/advanced
```

### 2. Add Your Images

Copy your images to the `docs/_static/` directory:
- `icon.png` - Project icon (used as logo)
- `screenshot.png` - Screenshot showing the logger output

### 3. Install Documentation Dependencies

```bash
pip install -r docs/requirements.txt
```

### 4. Build Documentation Locally

```bash
cd docs
make html
```

Open `docs/_build/html/index.html` in your browser.

### 5. Setup ReadTheDocs

1. Go to [readthedocs.org](https://readthedocs.org)
2. Import your GitHub repository
3. ReadTheDocs will automatically use `.readthedocs.yaml`
4. Documentation will build on every push

### 6. Configure GitHub Repository

Make sure your repository has:
- All documentation files committed
- `.readthedocs.yaml` in the root
- `docs/` directory with all RST files

### 7. Badge URLs

Add these badges to your README:

```markdown
[![Documentation Status](https://readthedocs.org/projects/richcolorlog/badge/?version=latest)](https://richcolorlog.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest)
```

## Building Commands

```bash
# Build HTML
make html

# Build PDF (requires LaTeX)
make latexpdf

# Live reload during development
make livehtml

# Check broken links
make linkcheck

# Clean build
make clean
```

## Notes

- The dark theme CSS is automatically applied
- Screenshots should be high quality, showing colorful output
- Icon should be square (recommended: 200x200 or 256x256 pixels)
